intro: Aster oreaster, commonly known as the showy aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern and central United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy purple to blue flowers bloom in the late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aster oreaster is often found in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, thriving in partial to full sunlight.
